results.title: Give sharks a chance
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, National Geographic Society, John Gau Productions and Orana Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Blue wilderness”.
After a series of shark attacks on the Gold Coast, Ron and Valerie Taylor, try to curb an outbreak of hysteria, and take a group of people, including two shark attack victims, to confront the object of their fears face to face.

results.title: The Birthday present
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Film Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson, a courageous pink elephant, leads his friends on a series of adventures. He is joined by Alfred, a leaky hot-water bottle, McDuff, a cheeky concertina, Diesel the dump truck and Squeaky the battered robot. The stories on this tape include: “The Birthday present”, “Playing games”, “Sharing”, “The Picnic”, “Windchimes” and “Cleaning day”.

results.title: Best of friends
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Film Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Six stories featuring the courageous pink elephant and his friends who amongst the clutter in Michael’s bedroom. The stories are: “Beginnings”, “Under the bed”, “Best of friends”, “The Thing outside”, “Helpless”, and “Moving house”.

results.title: Dinosaur tracks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson and his friends get together in six stories. In “Diesel tries to fly” all the toys are put in danger as Diesal tries out his wings. Squeaky’s good at guarding the bedroom but what about the “Dinosaur tracks”? Is Johnson falling apart as the toys follow the mysterious “Pink thread.” “Melissa’s dinosaur”, Victoria is introduced to the toys. In “Diesel who?”, the toy loses his memory after a nasty crash. McDuff feels very superior after a visit to the toyshop, and the toys try to get her back to her old self in The Homecoming.

results.title: Buried treasure
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson, the courageous pink elephant, leads his friends in 6 new stories. 1. “Baby of the family” Squeaky, the battered robot, was the baby of the toyroom, but also the strongest. How can the others protect her from dangerous games? 2. “The big freeze” It was the coldest day ever in Michael’s bedroom, so how will the toys get warm? 3. “Secrets” McDuff, the cheeky concertina, has a secret and all the other toys are desperate to know what it is. 4. “Operation Squeaky” Squeaky is broken and how will the other toys be able to fix her? 5. “Crying wolf” Diesel the dump truck is taught a lesson when he plays a nasty trick. 6. “Buried treasure” The toys set sail in search of buried treasure.

results.title: Testament: The Bible and history
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description: John Romer, an emminent archaelogist, undertakes a personal quest to examine the history of the Bible. He explores its origins and evolution through time as a rare and valuable sacred text, to a modern day paperback best seller available to the masses. Romer does not set out to discredit or disprove the literal truth of the Bible, but to examine how this influential text has shaped the world.

results.title: Paradise lost
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
In the last century the Bible has lost its central role as the scientific and moral arbiter. This programme describes this fall from sacredness and some of the visionaries who alternately attacked or protected the Bible’s word. The impact of men such as Martin Luther, Petrach, Walter Tindale who was the originator of the King James Bible, and Charles Darwin and his theory of evolution are seen as integral players in the history of the Bible.

results.title: Power and glory
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Virtually the sole source of learning in the western Dark Ages, the Bible’s character’s and stories were used to justify the social order and to offer its citizens security in this world and the next. After the fall of the Roman Empire, Christianity was nurtured in small settlements places like Ireland and Scotland. From these monastries came the most beautiful illuminated manuscripts of Bible text. Charlemagne restored Christianity to its glory and feudal society mirrored that of the Bible with its emphasis on order and place. Also features a close look at the ancient Byzantine church of Haiga Sophia in Istanbul.
